Questions.question:
If the cost of x metres of wire is d rupees, then what 
is the cost of y metres of wire at the same rate? 
 (M.B.A., 2002)

price of 16 such pens?

The price of 357 mangoes is ` 1517.25. What will 
be the approximate price of 49 dozens of such 
mangoes?

If a quarter kg of potato costs 60 paise, how many 
paise will 200 gm cost?

If 11.25 m of a uniform iron rod weighs 42.75 kg, 
what will be the weight of 6 m of the same rod?

second. Approximately, how many seconds will it take 
for the loom to weave 25 metres of cloth? 
 (M.B.A., 2003)

2
teaspoons of salt. If 3 teaspoons = 1 tablespoon, then 
how many tablespoons of salt will be needed to

metres at a particular time of a day. What is the

50 metres at the same time of the day?

8 of a job in 10 days. At this 
rate, how many more days will it take him to finish

In how many days can 42 men complete the same

many men would be required to do the same work 
in 20 days? (Bank P.O., 2008)

children. If 150 children have taken the meal, how 
many men will be catered to with the remaining 
meal?

grams is ` 28. What will be the cost of 27 packets,

If 7 maids with 7 mops cleaned 7 floors in 7 hours, 
how long would it take 3 maids to mop 3 floors

sq. m of ground in 4 hours. How long would it

machines can produce a total of 180 bottles per

5 days? (Bank P.O., 2007)

50 people consume 350 kg of rice in 30 days. In how 
many days will 35 people consume 50 kg of rice? 
 (NABARD, 2008)

In a dairy farm, 40 cows eat 40 bags of husk in 40 
days. In how many days one cow will eat one bag 
of husk?

days. In how many days will 12 men and 8 women

days, working 7 hours a day; in how many days 
will 16 pumps raise 1736 tonnes of water, working 
9 hours a day?

for ` 21.25, then the number of lamps, which can be 
lighted 4 hours daily for 30 days, for ` 76.50, is

460 chairs in 24 days, how many chairs will 18 
carpenters make in 36 days, each working 8 hours 
a day?

If 5 spiders can catch five flies in five minutes, 
how many flies can hundred spiders catch in 100
minutes? (SNAP, 2005)

2 persons working 2 hours a day assemble 2
machines in 2 days. The number of machines 
assembled by 6 persons working 6 hours a day in 
6 days is (A.A.O., 2009)

The work done by a man is double the work done 
by a woman in the same time. If 10 men can do a 
piece of work in 8 days, then in how many days 
that work can be done by 3 men and 4 women?

A wall of 100 metres can be built by 7 men or 10 
women in 10 days. How many days will 14 men and 
20 women take to build a wall of 600 metres?

If 10 men or 20 boys can make 260 mats in 20 days, 
then how many mats will be made by 8 men and 
4 boys in 20 days? (C.P.O., 2007)

If 600 men dig a 5.5 m wide, 4 m deep and 405 m 
long canal in half an hour, then how long a canal 
will 2500 men, working for 6 hours, dig if it is 10 
m wide and 8 m deep?

64 persons can dig a trench 50 m long, 2 m wide 
and 2 m deep in 5 days, working 12 hours daily. 
In how many days, working 8 hours daily, will 80 
persons dig another trench 75 m long, 4 m wide 
and 3 m deep?

21 binders can bind 1400 books in 15 days. How 
many binders will be required to bind 800 books 
in 20 days? (Bank P.O., 2009)

fabrication consignment in 16 days. 8 additional 
artisans had to be deployed for the same consignment 
and together they completed it in 4 days less than 
the earlier estimate. The number of artisans initially 
employed was

If 9 examiners can examine a certain number of 
answer books in 12 days, working 5 hours a day; 
for how many hours a day would 4 examiners have 
to work in order to examine twice the number of 
answer books in 30 days?

If 17 labourers can dig a ditch 20 m long in 18 days, 
working 8 hours a day; how many more labourers 
should be engaged to dig a similar ditch 39 m long 
in 6 days, each labourer working 9 hours a day?

20 men complete one-third of a piece of work in 20 
days. How many more men should be employed to 
finish the rest of the work in 25 more days?		
 (G.B.O., 2007)

A rope makes 70 rounds of the circumference of a 
cylinder whose radius of the base is 14 cm. How 
many times can it go round a cylinder with radius 
20 cm?

If x men, working x hours per day, can do x units 
of work in x days, then y men, working y hours per 
day would be able to complete how many units of 
work in y days?

A contract is to be completed in 46 days and 117 
men were set to work, each working 8 hours a day. 
After 33 days, 4
7 of the work is completed. How 
many additional men may be employed so that the 
work may be completed in time, each man now 
working 9 hours a day? (M.A.T., 2005)

The normal dosage of a particular medicine is t
tablets per day for each patient. A hospital’s current 
supply of these tablets will last p patients for d days. 
If the recommended dosage increases by 20% and 
the number of patients decreases by one-third, then 
for how many days will the hospital’s supply last?

Some persons can do a piece of work in 12 days. 
Two times the number of such persons will do half 
of that work in :

12 persons can do a piece of work in 4 days. How 
many persons are required to complete 8 times the 
work in half the time? (S.S.C., 2004)

If 5 engines consume 6 metric tonnes of coal when 
each is running 9 hours a day, how many metric 
tonnes of coal will be needed for 8 engines, each 
running 10 hours a day, it being given that 3 engines 
of the former type consume as much as 4 engines 
of the latter type? (M.A.T., 2008)

If 9 men working 1 7
2 hours a day can finish a piece 
of work in 20 days, then how many days will be 
taken by 12 men, working 6 hours a day to finish 
the work? It is being given that 2 men of latter type 
work as much as 3 men of the former type. 
 (L.I.C.A.A.O., 2007)

If a certain number of workmen can do a piece of 
work in 25 hours, in how many hours will another 
set of an equal number of men, do a piece of work, 
twice as great, supposing that 2 men of the first set 
can do as much work in an hour, as 3 men of the 
second set do in an hour?

15 men take 21 days of 8 hours each to do a piece of 
work. How many days of 6 hours each would 21 women 
take, if 3 women do as much work as 2 men?

A contractor employed 30 men to do a piece of work 
in 38 days. After 25 days, he employed 5 men more 
and the work was finished one day earlier. How 
many days he would have been behind, if he had 
not employed additional men?

In a barrack of soldiers there was stock of food for 
190 days for 4000 soldiers. After 30 days 800 soldiers 
left the barrack. For how many days shall the left 
over food last for the remaining soldiers?
(P.C.S., 2006)

A garrison of 500 men had provisions for 27 days. 
After 3 days a reinforcement of 300 men arrived. 
For how many more days will the remaining food 
last now? (M.B.A., 2006)

A garrison had provisions for a certain number of 
days. After 10 days, 1
5
 of the men desert and it is 
found that the provisions will now last just as long 
as before. How long was that? (M.B.A., 2003)

they are strengthened by 500 men and the food lasts 
for 35 days longer, the number of men originally in 
the fort were

66 days. At the end of a fortnight, reinforcement 
arrives and it is found that ration will last only for 
20 days more. The strength of the reinforcement is

A team of workers was employed by a contractor 
who undertook to finish 360 pieces of an article in 
a certain number of days. Making four more pieces 
per day than was planned, they could complete the 
job a day ahead of schedule. How many days did 
they take to complete the job? (M.A.T., 2007)

The work done by a woman in 8 hours is equal 
to the work done by a man in 6 hours and by 
a boy in 12 hours. If working 6 hours per day 
9 men can complete a work in 6 days, then in 
how many days can 12 men, 12 women and 
12 boys together finish the same work, working 8 
hours per day? (M.A.T., 2007)

12 men and 18 boys, working 
1 7
2 hours a day, can 
do a piece of work in 60 days. If a man works equal 
to 2 boys, then how many boys will be required to 
help 21 men to do twice the work in 50 days, working 
9 hours a day?

If 3 men or 6 boys can do a piece of work in 10 
days, working 7 hours a day; how many days will it 
take to complete a piece of work twice as large with 
6 men and 2 boys working together for 8 hours a day?

2 men and 7 boys can do a piece of work in 14 days; 
3 men and 8 boys can do the same in 11 days. Then, 
8 men and 6 boys can do three times the amount 
of this work in :

Large, medium and small ships are used to bring 
water. 4 large ships carry as much water as 7 small 
ships, 3 medium ships carry the same amount of 
water as 2 large ships and 1 small ship. 15 large, 7 
medium and 14 small ships, each made 36 journeys 
and brought a certain quantity of water. In how 
many journeys would 12 large, 14 medium and 21 
small ships bring the same quantity? (M.A.T., 2007)

If 2 m. 60 cm cloth is required for one shirt, then 
the cloth required for 7 shirts is ……..
[APTET, 2011]

The cost of 4 dozen papers is ` 24. The cost of 1 
score of papers (in rupees) is …….
 [APTET, 2011]

The cost of 8 fans and 14 ovens is ` 36.520. What 
is the cost of 12 fans and 21 ovens?
[SBI—Clerk Level, 2012]
